title: Bi-Weekly Food and Recipes Thread
selftext:
Foodies of r/India, tried out a new dish? Experimented with cooking yourself and lived to tell the story? Share here!

Feel free to share recipes, eating places, pictures, experiences etc.

**Food and Recipes Thread is posted every two weeks on Friday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Food+and+Recipes+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/tti3fyiqw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=899972afbc4bab665798a0f5917960a98ec4f4d5
comments: Tried the new trend, Maggi cooked in one-third beer, one-third coke and one-third milk mix. Ate it and died. I am alive now but am I really alive?!
What is the best food/snacks while drinking? Other than gobi/mashroom/panner for vegetarians?

LOL these people downvoting for no reason.  Just mve on if you don't like the topic.

I have a question: what can I do with chicken and yogurt in an oven?
marinate the chicken with the yoghurt and other spices, keep it in the fridge for a couple of hours and then bake it in the oven?
OK, thanks.  Adding tomatoes should work too, right?   I'd assume bay leaf, tomatoes, S&P.  What spices?  Tumeric and Cumin?
yea sure, whatever you want man. I personally use just pepper, salt and chilli powder for marination.
I have Chili powder, I'll try that.  Thanks, sincerely.
